intro: Syncephalantha, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of a single species, Syncephalantha salsoloides, which is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of blue-gray, hairy leaves and its tall, sparsely branched stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
